data.title: When debugger stops on a function breakpoint - it is not obvious why the debugger stopped

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I set a function breakpoint and it stops on that "function", it is not obvious that the debugger stopped because of a function breakpoint e.g.:

![vscodefuncbreakpoint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5177512/13472433/1ba45c86-e072-11e5-8a17-977c13bd2e7b.png)

Notice that the "normal" breakpoint above gets a red glyph and a tooltip but where the debugger has stopped does not have any sort of breakpoint glyph or tooltip.

Now I would NOT want VSCode to try to find all the spots in my source where the "function" exists and put a static breakpoint glyph on those spots.  However, when the debugger is stopped on a function breakpoint, I think it would be useful to either A) provide a tooltip indicating the debugger stopped on function breakpoint "`<name of function>`" or B) a **temporary** red breakpoint glyph that goes away as soon as you step off that line (or continue).  Or you could provide both.

This is an example of what this might look like:
![vscodefuncbreakpoint2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5177512/13472911/34d5af00-e074-11e5-94f1-bd86d369240d.png)

data.title: Possible to install extensions offline?
data.body:
Hi,

is it possible to install extensions while being offline? At times I don't have direct access to the internet, it would be really great if I could download the extensions beforehand, and install later while offline. I wouldn't mind copying files into specific directories by hand, as long as it gets the job done.

data.title: Function breakpoints - protocol allows condition but no UI to set condition

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Maybe I'm missing something in the debug UI experience but I see no way to add a condition to a function breakpoint even though the debug protocol supports it.

data.title: No network error should be improved
data.body:
When trying to install an extension without an internet connection I get the following error:

> getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND marketplace.visualstudio.com marketplace.visualstudio.com:443

Something like this would be better:

> Cannot install extension without internet connection

data.title: Feature Request: Jumping between lines, selections and an uber-cool "Goto"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
One of the many hundreds of awesome features of `vi(m)` is the ability to jump between several lines and do all sorts of things very quickly. However, that's very difficult to accomplish with the traditional editors.  
And this is something I constantly end up missing in VSCode. While there exists a vim emulation, its far from properly usable - At this moment, the idiomatic VSCode way seems a lot more productive. 

Meanwhile, the `Goto` feature is often underlooked. Currently the `Goto` command pops up the command manager prompting for the line number/col number. 

However, it'd be a relatively easy tweak to this to allow jumping between lines in a relative way. So, the proposal is: 
1. For the most part the `Goto` behavior is unchanged.
2. Prefix a number with `+`, say `+20` - now Goto uses the relative information instead of directly going to line 20. So, if the cursor was already at line 20, this ends ups moving to line 40. 
3. Prefix with `-`, and do just the opposite. Move backward. 
4. Column interactions should remain the same. 
5. Press and Hold "Shift" while hitting "Enter" to finalize the "Goto" command (Shift+Enter, instead of just typing the number and pressing Enter): This ends up selecting the entire block of text inbetween. 

All the above should be relatively simple implementation. However, the next one is quite different, but will be extremely productive. When the Goto command is open - `Start highlighting brackets, parenthesis, and significant codepoint like class names. And the highlight should be accompanied by quick text hints to jump to them straight away`. Somewhat like how "Vimium" (https://vimium.github.io/) does it on Chrome for links. 

I was looking for a starting point for an extension for the last feature. However, since VSCode provides no way for custom UI interfaces, of overlay, it seems impossible to do it using the currently exposed extensions points. So, I guess its completely upto the team to implement something like these, or if someone can provide suggestions on how to proceed with the hightlights like Vimium does, I'd be happy to prototype an extension. :)

data.title: Show commands in `Command Palette` based on context (like `when` in KeyBindings)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When you define a `keybinding` in `package.json`, you are able to define `when` the keybinging works. So, for instance, if you define a keybinding like below, it will only work if you are the editor has focus, but not if the focus in TreeView or Find panels, for instance:

``` json
   "when": "editorTextFocus"
```

The same flexibility could be added when you create the command itself (`contributes.commands`), so it should not appear in the `Command Palette`, unless the `when` clause is satisfied.

This could make easier to define commands for the _Workspace/Project_  or _Active Document_.

Thanks in advance

data.title: `gutterIconPath` is not shown in High Contrast theme
data.body:
I'm creating a `TextEditorDecorationType`, defining `gutterIconPath` with a `.png` file. It works fine for all stock themes, but it is not shown when using the _High Contrast_ theme.

Is there any _format/setting_ for the image to work with _High Contrast_ theme?

The image is [this one](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alefragnani/vscode-bookmarks/master/images/bookmark.png)

Thanks in advance.

data.title: [json] VSCode does not complain about syntactically broken JSON files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## The Problem

VSCode can nicely handle comments in JSON files. However, the [JSON](http://www.json.org) specification [does **not** allow comments in JSON files](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/244777/can-i-use-comments-inside-a-json-file). Therefore most JSON parsers fail when JSON files contain comments. E.g. [`package.json`](https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json) fails, and even the typescript compiler fails on [tsconfig.json](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/tsconfig.json) files that include comments.

Another problem is that syntax highlighting does not work on github. For example, the file [`extensions/xml/xml.configuration.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/54609ce3f6c701a851157b5a936818b724694a53/extensions/xml/xml.configuration.json) ist not legal JSON. This is symptomatic for repositories that are managed with VSCode:
- @dbaeumer in [`eslint/.vscode/tasks.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-eslint/blob/1629dbe09d4e252f4fd49fb3786079425ab9e253/eslint/.vscode/tasks.json)
- @weinand in [`vscode-node-debug/.vscode/launch.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/blob/20fe4f767477b0ad8fe0ee6e60b3b265ad087321/.vscode/launch.json#L33)
- @egamma in [`vscode-go/blame/master/.vscode/launch.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/blob/d3a1502c4766f4fe5a6d471a7d0b95e1f46b7cae/.vscode/launch.json)
## Proposal: create a new file type, e.g. `.tson`

Instead of misleading people about the syntax of JSON by providing support for comments in JSON files, VSCode should rather use a new format like `TSON`, that would be an extension of JSON that allows for comments. There could be a simpler pre-processor for TSON (like [JSON.minify](http://blog.getify.com/json-comments/)) that converts TSON into JSON by stripping away the comments.

With such a new file type, VSCode could happily use them without compromising the integrity of existing `.json` files. 

In addition, it would be cool to use typescript ambient definitions for `.tson` files. I really like the typescript  [schema for `tasks.json`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks_appendix).

data.title: Debt: context menu should be created from main process
data.body: Works fine, only issue is to find a way how to know which action to run on the renderer side when clicking on the main side.

data.title: Indent command keyboard shortcut
data.body:
alt+up shifts a line up
alt+down shifts it down

I have set

```
{ "key": "alt+right",           "command": "tab",
                                   "when": "editorTextFocus" },
{ "key": "alt+left",            "command": "outdent",
                                   "when": "editorTextFocus" },`
```

And it works as expected for selected text.
But if no text is selected only the tab command alt+right fails.
It is just making a tab.

Could we have an indent command?

data.title: Simplify test script definition in package.json
data.body:
As npm puts files from `./node_modules/.bin` in `$PATH` when running npm scripts, running bin commands from npm dependencies could be run directly, without a bin script deep inside `node_modules`.

P.S. great editor you've made so far!

data.title: code folding doesn't respect peek ui
data.body:
- open Peek UI, for example I did a Peed Definition on gulp in a pretty standard gulpfile.

Before folding, the Peek UI is open with the beak pointing at the symbol I invoked the action on:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13462454/d0c4765e-e087-11e5-9147-82106c178c33.png)

Now, fold some code higher up in the file, I did line 33 here:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13462483/e9c6f564-e087-11e5-98e9-f863e9d28fde.png)

Result: the Peek UI stays visible but the it is no longer pointing at the correct symbol. There are many variations of this (e.g. fold some code, do a Peek on a symbol that has code folded into it, then expand the code).

I would expect: 
- if the symbol i did a peek on is no longer visible, i would expect the peek ui to disappear
- if the symbol moves because code below is folded, i would expect the peek ui to track to the symbol and remain open

data.title: Tune the extension tips appearance in status bar
data.body: The extension tips should appear whenever there are new extensions for a user to look at.

data.title: Request keyboard binding configurable to execute multiple actions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great if VS Code's "command" property of a keyboard binding could be configued as an array of actions to perform.

For example, some requests (#3588 for one) would be moot if `cmd+s` could be configured to execute `HookyQR.beautify` then `workbench.action.files.save`.

data.title: Suggestion: Add option for Beautify / Format on Save
data.body: My last suggestion for this was closed but I think the request was misunderstood. I understand that there is a format on type option which I already have enabled. What I was requesting in #3588 was to have the formatter/beautifier invoked on the entire document when it is saved regardless of any edits that may or may not have been done. Basically this would invoke "editor.action.format" when the document is saved and save the formatted result. I use this feature extensively in other editors and it allows all devs to keep code inline regardless of who or when the file was last revised.

data.title: Debug fails to recognise the task has failed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- Clone https://github.com/Pure-D/code-d and checkout commit 09ce158566e94bd28cfba9a9fd1365717fa863fd.
- Open that workspace in Code.
- Open `launch.json` and change the `outDir` values to use `${workspaceRoot}`
- Hit F5

You get this error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13458948/a82dc270-e070-11e5-8aeb-05a4079aefba.png)

Open the task log and you'll see this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13458956/b72a2746-e070-11e5-8029-bc9a4c3fd8c7.png)

Meaning that the `npm` task failed to execute.

When I run that task in the terminal, I can confirm that it returns a non-zero value. So why isn't Debug picking that up and informing me that the problem occurred in the task itself?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13458970/ce0f880c-e070-11e5-954b-ab53c78c25f9.png)

data.title: "Path must be string. Received null" error when attempting to start debugger
data.body:
Using VSCode 0.10.10-insider on Windows 7

I can no longer debug my JavaScript in this build. It just throws this error

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563860/13458737/2bef9a1e-e0c3-11e5-82fa-0e1dae4e271c.PNG)

Falling back to the 0.10.8 release on the "stable" channel, I can debug this project again. I could also debug this project with the previous insiders build.

To reproduce:
1. Clone my repo https://github.com/jumpinjackie/jsdoc-typescript-plugin
2. `npm install`
3. `npm run-script tsc`
4. Open this clone dir in VSCode 0.10.10-insider
5. Start debugging with the provided launch.json

As an aside, it would be nice for such errors to present an option to show the stack trace as well, because I have no clue where to even look to determine the cause of this problem.

data.title: Error should have action to edit the launch.json file
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13458813/e1d1e16a-e06f-11e5-9ba0-e1a5f646157a.png)

It's even hard to figure out that this is debug related and/or that the attributes mentioned occur in `launch.json`.

This will hit **every extension developer** when they update, so marking it as important. IMO it should be fixed for the Feb stable release.

data.title: Match whole word does not work for not latin characters (at least for cyrillic)
data.body:

```
я
компилятор
обфускация

i
compiler
cli
```

And if I am trying to find all whole words "я", vscode highlights all three first words. But if I am trying to find "i", vs code highlights only fourth word.

VSCode settings through GPO/Registry
data.body: In VisualStudio Code I'm able to overwrite `"telemetry.enableCrashReporter": false`, but this has to be done manually for each new user. Is there any way to set this through a GPO or Registry setting, so I don't have to run to each user and disable it?

data.title: New files get view state of previously open file
data.body:
- have a JS file, do some collapsing and set cursors
- set a breakpoint in 'textFileEditor.saveTextEditorViewState'
- in the file explorer click on the new file action and create a new file
- the breakpoint is hit when the file view state for the JS file is stored (good!)
- the breakpoint is hit again, when the view state of the new file is set, but again with the state of the JS file (not good), The view state contains cursor positions and folding regions which do not apply to the new file.
